column4: can someone help me get ubuntu to recognize the second core on my Core 2 Duo?   kernel version: 2.6.15-27-amd64-generic #1 SMP PREEMPT.....i know i keep asking but i had to RMA 3 motherboards to get this thing working and now it isnt even working
why in the world are you using an AMD kernel for your Core 2 Duo?
im quite new to all this didnt know which one to download
are you using Edgy or Dapper?
dapper
try installing the package linux-686-smp.
use the command "sudo aptitude install linux-686-smp"
i tried doing that before but it was failing probably bc i was using apt-get
the nice thing about Edgy is it detects what kernel to use automatically
i'd remove the amd kernel and try using the package linux-686-smp
ill try doing that, and if it is a no go....i guess ill go get edgy.....this computer is solely a Folding@home machine so i just need something that is not going to crash
"Couldnt find any package whose name or description matched "linux-686-smp" no packages will be installed, upgradedd oor removed
hmm...
i dont need the cd in do i?
run sudo aptitude update and try again
that didnt work
have you edited your sources.list at all?
no
I have no idea why that's not installing...
i need to run out so im going to download edgy while i am out....what version should i download?
Edgy Eft is Ubuntu v 6.10
